comments:
in i1204

I got the admin ui agent, setup the repos pointing at eclipse.org/testupdates, created a profile etc and then installed the SDK IU into the new profile.  The download proceeded nicely and at some point well into the process, the following NPE showed up and stopped the install.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine 4 0 2007-12-04 22:39:18.575
!MESSAGE 
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine 4 8 2007-12-04 22:39:18.575
!MESSAGE Error during phase: install.
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.equinox.p2.touchpoint.eclipse 4 0 2007-12-04 22:39:18.575
!MESSAGE Error saving manipulator
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.installBundle(EquinoxBundlesState.java:597)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.composeState(EquinoxBundlesState.java:396)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.composeNewState(EquinoxBundlesState.java:310)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxBundlesState.<init>(EquinoxBundlesState.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxManipulatorImpl.getBundlesState(EquinoxManipulatorImpl.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.frameworkadmin.equinox.internal.EquinoxManipulatorImpl.save(EquinoxManipulatorImpl.java:372)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.touchpoint.eclipse.LazyManipulator.save(LazyManipulator.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.touchpoint.eclipse.EclipseTouchpoint.completePhase(EclipseTouchpoint.java:97)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine.Phase.postPerform(Phase.java:177)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine.Phase.perform(Phase.java:99)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine.Phase.perform(Phase.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine.PhaseSet.perform(PhaseSet.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine.Engine.perform(Engine.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.operations.ProvisioningUtil.performProvisioningPlan(ProvisioningUtil.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.operations.ProvisioningUtil.performInstall(ProvisioningUtil.java:273)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.operations.InstallOperation.doExecute(InstallOperation.java:33)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.operations.ProvisioningOperation.execute(ProvisioningOperation.java:41)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ui.ProvisioningOperationRunner$1.run(ProvisioningOperationRunner.java:52)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

I also saw this today, and at some point realized that I had created a profile that was pointing to an install folder that had not been cleaned out.  After cleaning out the install folder and trying again, I did not see the error. Not sure if this is the cause, but I thought I should mention it...

I'm a bit surprised since at install time an exception here would mean that the file is missing... I wonder if this could have been caused by the problems we had with the bundle pool.

To "fix" bug #212068, I put some code handling this exception and that would therefore prevent this problem.
That said, to make sure that the file is here I have added a new check in the eclipse touchpoint.
